label: Behavior 47844675
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the combination of stable speed, small heading variations, and slowly changing COG indicates the vessel is navigating along a gently curving channel or coastal path; the trajectory approximates a circular arc with radius ~2.5 km, modeled by a parametric equation: lat(t) ≈ 53.966752 + 0.00128 × t + 0.00004 × t², lon(t) ≈ 9.257525 + 0.00178 × t + 0.00012 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed between 6.4 and 6.7 knots across the trajectory)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG changes slowly from 39.0° to 35.9° over time, indicating a smooth, progressive turn to the right)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading remains close to 40.0°, with only minor adjustments, suggesting controlled rudder input)
